issue.title: entitlement.l.softbank.ne.jp
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking)
 [http://entitlement.l.softbank.ne.jp/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fentitlement.l.softbank.ne.jp%2F)
### Comment
> Try to login My Softbank from https://www.softbank.jp/mysoftbank/ .
> It happens only accessed via mobile data.
> This is likely because subscriber identification is performed using mobile data without password.

### Screenshots

  ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/prpztfdrgtckgocwwogg8g4kg0ck0o8jw2zwl4ubk0.jpg?nc=1)
</details>

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

### Comment
> I have this setup in my devices internet connection settings. Up untill about a week ago for that specific site. Now ads and popups all the time
>

comment.body:
> I have added some rules to prevent/remove popups scripts.
> 
Thank you.

> Regarding incorrect blocking. The same problem sometimes occurs on my end even without an ad blocker, so it looks like an issue with the website. Are you sure that it's caused by AdGuard?

I am not 100% sure, but I feel it is because of it.
It's sometimes very hard to pin point these as different times different things happen.

comment.body:
Not reproduced with AdGuard filters on my end.
Try to leave only AdGuard filters, update them (wait almost one minute there), clear browser data, restart it, open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
I can't check this on my end. Which filter causes it? Please also test it with a rule below.
```adblock
@@||wifi.inflightinternet.com^$generichide,genericblock
```
